subject: Travel
title: Cultural Appropriation Debates
description: A micro-lesson that makes Cultural Appropriation Debates usable.

hook.text: Wearing a kimono in Kyoto as a tourist is encouraged. Wearing one as a Halloween costume sparks outrage.

buildup.text: Japan actively promotes kimono-wearing by visitors. Rental shops surround every major temple.

discovery.text: The debate over cultural appropriation centers on context â€” who wears what, where, and why.

twist.text: Indian designers welcome global interest in saris. Native American leaders reject headdress costumes at festivals.

climax.text: No universal rule exists. Each culture decides what sharing looks like versus what disrespect feels like.

punchline.text: Borrowing culture is welcome until it becomes a costume.

quiz.question: Why is wearing a kimono in Kyoto generally accepted?
options: Japan actively encourages tourists to wear them
